messages: 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:17): i wish roy would actually read the sniffing part of hte spec
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:18): he seems to have this idea that the spec defines an ungodly sniffing algorithm
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:18): when in fact it's barely enough to make browser vendors happy (all of them have complained about some part of it)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:18): (though ironically not the same part, which amuses me)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:29): I hope 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c and anne have fun with the task force
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:29): "fun"
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:29): that is totally what I'm expecting
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:30): i've subscribed to the list already
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:30): there's a list already?
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:30): what's the new list?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): i look forward to reading it avidly and not being allowed to post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): the list was created months ago
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): public-forms.tg
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): er
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:31): public-forms-tf
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:32): I will be impressed if the task force can even reach a consensus decision on what its actual job is
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:32): me too!
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:32): it doesn't have subscribe/unsubscribe links next to it. Is anyone allowed to subscribe?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:32): it's a public list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:32): anyone can subscribe to any w3c public list
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:33): from a productivity point of view i am really happy i'm not going to be allowed to be involved in those discussions
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:33): from the point of view of my argumentative self, though, i'm jealous :-P
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:34): are only the 6 TF members allowed to discuss on that list?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:34): i think it would be pointless to have officially appointed members if other people are allowed to take part in the discussion
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:35): but i guess i'm just assuming we're not allowed to post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:35): seems like it would be rude to post
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:35): for us
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:37): oops, I sent my subscription request to public-forms-tf instead of public-forms-tf-request by mistake, though it still worked :-)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:37): heh
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:41): http://www.w3.org/mid/<email/> is an interesting mail to see cross-posted to public-html and wai-xtech

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:41): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, on the top issues list, could you add a vote count for the issues beside the names, so one doesn't have to open them up to see
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:42): someone should advise him that he should be using the title attribute
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:51): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: should I find a new IRC channel where I am free to express my opinions honestly and have a sense of humor?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:52): whatwg is such a channel, if you feel otherwise please let me know by private IM and i will deal with the problem
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:53): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, what did 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a complain about?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (09:53): lachy: (i'd already written all the backend code for that, just had to code in the client side)
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:54): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: about my comments above circa 11:30 PM
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:55): the "fun" and "that is totally what I'm expecting" comments?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (09:55): and "I will be impressed if the task force can even reach a consensus decision on what its actual job is"

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (09:58): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e, if I open http://www.whatwg.org/issues/listen directly in Firefox, it freezes and crashes. I wonder if that's a bug in FF or a problem with one of my extensions.

67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (09:59): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c: I have no issues with what you are saying for yourself. I have issues with WG loosing time on arguments about what you are saying. And as long as you are free to express yourself in public, you have to accept in return that people are free to express negative comments about your statements. :) that is the price of your free expression. It's not one way.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:00): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: you are free to express anything you want, but knowing that you may forward any random thing I say here to the HTML Working Group chairs with a complaint, and without even talking to me about it first, makes this not a comfortable place to converse
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:01): it /is/ a public place. it /is/ logged online. it /is not/ a comfortable place by its nature.  Wake up :)
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:01): 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c, indeed. I've had 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a and DanC both do that with previous things I've said
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:01): is always amazed at the lack of maturity of people with regards to public expression and its consequences
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:02): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: well, my alternative is to find a place of private expression where you are not invited

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:03): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: but I would instead prefer to converse with relative comfort and in semi-obscurity, as is the norm on most public IRC channels
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:03): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: could be a problem accessing window.parent or something
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:03): semi-obscurity doesn't exist.
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:03): specifically when the logs are available
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:04): note that it is not about me.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:04): it is the social norm of most IRC channels to not make a big deal of things said in the channel outside the channel (unless there is an unresolvable personal conflict)

67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:04): it is about expressing one-self in a public environment which is recorded. Requesting free expression and not giving the right to other to react is... very surprising
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:04): while I can't force you to respect this social norm, I think it is rude not to do so
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:05): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a, others do have the right to react, but they should take it up with the person directly before involving anyone else
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:05): I'm not denying you any rights
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:06): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: this specific channels is big wide open -> http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:06): remembers suddenly the discussion about old usenet suddenly archived by Google

f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:06): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a, that doesn't mean that one should involve higher authorities as soon as someone takes offense by what was said, without first discussing it with the offender
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:07): people willing to fight for the semi-obscurity
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:07): f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220: I didn't take offense
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:07): read my comment above
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:07): "I have issues with WG loosing time on arguments about what you are saying."
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:08): could someone clarify exactly what it is that is being complained about?
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:09): by me or by Karl?
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:09): both
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:09): me: http://krijnhoetmer.nl/irc-logs/whatwg/20070822#l-132
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:09): maciej: that I sent the sentence to danc and chris and maciej to say that it was not appropriate
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:10): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a, I don't think it was appropriate either

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:10): I'm complaining that Karl quoted a snippet of our conversation and sent it to the HTML working Group chairs with his comment that he thinks it makes me unsuitable as a Forms Task Force participant
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:11): not what I said 65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:11): which, personally, I think is nonsense; being pessimistic about the outcome doesn't in any way mean that I won't participate in good faith

67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:11): "I'm note sure that is a positive statement on your will to achieve work in this task force. I find it quite sad, personally. Either you participate to something because you think it will be fruitful, either you don't participate."

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:12): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: please resist forwarding conversations from this channel to the chairs without discussing it with the people you are quoting first.

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:12): I participate in web standards because it is part of my job to make them good and to make the process succeed, not because it necessarily fills my heart with joy
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:12): hixie: I'm willing to do that.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:13): thank you.
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:13): the funny thing
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:13): does that apply to #html-wg too?
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:13): is that at first I sent it in private specifically to make a recorded mess online
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:13): which maciej just did ;)
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:13): #html-wg is danc's problem
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:14): to not make
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:14): you know, public-html is amusing
55c91f724bbdbdcd4c8ef11d65ef64f7 (10:14): 'lo

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:14): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: well, if you asked me about my comments here in the first place, then the public record would have our conversation, not just my out-of-context remarks
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:15): many threads start with one message that i save because it has good feedback in it, followed by a lot of messages that really don't help much either way
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:15): as an example:
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:15): http://www.w3.org/mid/<email/> - useful feedback
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:15): http://www.w3.org/mid/<email/> - quibbling feedback
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:15): http://www.w3.org/mid/op.txe6ftgzidj3kv@hp-a0a83fcd39d2 - feedback repeating the first point for the benefit of the second poster

65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:15): 67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a: I stand behind them, but I will note that I participate in good faith and make a strong effort in many endeavors despite pessimism about the outcome
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:16): the HTML Working Group itself is one such example
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:16): but I would like to be free to voice my cynicism once in a while
f139aba52f9fa1394b4034a7954b2220 (10:19): hmm. I still haven't received the confirmation email to confirm my subscription to public-forms-tf was successful.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:19): maybe we're on a waiting list
67ab482559bf3f830bdf948ab892778a (10:20): I'm not the moderator
65325d50b2e25aca54bc871b89758c9c (10:21): good night everyone
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:24): nn

a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:25): 69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e - does your admonishment about forwarding links to comments in the public log for this channel apply only to forwarding such links to chairs, or to anybody?

69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:31): a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2: it was merely a request, to karl, that he not forward conversations from this channel to the chairs without discussing them with the people involved first
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:32): it is naturally common courtesey to speak to someone before you quote them in any case
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:34): I agree completely.
a9b326df4e6da61c5b6f5e1058be83a2 (10:34): It's just that this is first time I can every remember seeing you make any request from anybody on this channel about what their behavior should be.
69b0d3dfe919a6b860a9fac82de52a7e (10:35): it's the first time i've had someone say they were starting to feel uncomfortable talking openly in this channel
